fields.description:
In the Working Copy Changes (or Staged), when there are multiple files listed there, if you select them all, and then try and deslect one, you cannot.

The only way I have found to deselect is to double click a single selection which tries to open it in an editor. When returning to source tree, only the double clicked file will be selected.

Changing to branch view and back doesn't solve this.
fields.summary: Unable to deselect files in working or staged changes

fields.description:
I would like to request a feature.

I would like to be able to change the viewing panels. Change their location, delete panels you don't want,...

For example: Within our company, alot of people just want a basic screen to do GIT management. They don't need an internal comparison etc..
fields.summary: Change Viewing Panels

fields.description:
The rebase feature does not function correctly. When I rebase from [commit hash] interactively and then choose squash with previous commits, I have to repeat this process several times because the rebase function only actually squashes 1-3 commits. So I have to keep doing it over and over again until the feature branch is finally truly squashed into the commits I want to squash it into. Then I have to ammend commit to edit the commit message because: 

A. the edit commit message from the rebase menu sucks, and 
B. The software thinks it actually squashed x amount of commits but it didn't so I get a rebase message that looks like:
[hash] commit message (+3 squashed commit)

Squashed commit:

[hash] commit message
[hash] commit message
[hash] commit message
[hash] commit message (+5 squashed commits)

Squashed commit:

[hash] commit message
[hash] commit message
...

However your rebase function is broken for several other reasons than this actual bug.  If I am on a feature branch I should be able to say rebase interactively on develop, as opposed to  rebase all children of [hash] interactively. I will admit that the logic of `rebase all children of [hash] interactively` could def. come in handy in some scenarios, but with git flow (a feature built in to your software) it makes more sense to rebase feature on develop, or rebase hotfix on master etc... 

Secondly, why put in the edit commit message and not give it the exact same functionality as when I create a normal commit message (i.e. allow me to do carriage returns, spell check etc...)?? You might as well fix the rebase bug I addressed at the begging of this issue and not allow me to customize the message at all!

I'm pretty disappointed in the rebasing feature for source tree which sucks because it has been the best git client I ever used, but if your not going to correctly implement rebasing I'd rather you pull it out all together, it makes the software experience a lot more loathsome than I use to feel about using source tree.  Until this functionality is fixed I am just going to pretend that the rebasing features don't exist and rebase from the terminal "/
fields.summary: Rebase Feature Is Broken

fields.description: The clone from bitbucket screen forces the use of "-b default" when cloning a Mercurial repo from bitbucket. This means that if you create the repo from the bitbucket website then you cannot then immediately clone it from SourceTree like the instruction page says because the repo empty and SourceTree is expecting a "default" branch.
fields.summary: Cannot clone empty project from bitbucket list

fields.description: There is no particular moment when it happens. The only way we found to unblock the situation is to restart sourcetree. There is no problem with git as we can do some operations on repositories with the terminal.
fields.summary: Regularly, Sourcetree is loading continually and we can't do anything

fields.description:
When I click the external diff button on a committed file that is not in my current branch, SourceTree creates two temp files from the previous and current versions and then launces the external diff application (Beyond compare in my case). Looking on the files it takes me a few seconds at best and minutes at worst to understand if the newer version is on the left pane or the right. 

My suggestion is this: Beyond compare shows the files dates as shown in the attached image. If you set these to the correct dates before opening BC it would be much easier to figure out the dates of the files shown
fields.summary: When running external diff set the file dates correctly

fields.description:
When right-clicking a parent commit, the context menu has a blank line where the "Rebase children of xyz..." is normally displayed.  Clicking on the blank line will still display the Interactive Rebase dialog and the rebase may be completed without errors.  It is only the text that is missing form the menu.

This occurs on only 1 developer's workstation.  All other developers on our team see the menu item as expected.
fields.summary: Interactive Rebase option in context menu is blank

fields.description: I have a collection of text files that keep localization information for a project. They are Java .properties files. The files are named "en-us.properties", "es.properties", etc. I can only preview changes to the English files, but not for other languages. SourceTree treats these files as binary when they are not. Just because a file contains characters from other languages, it does not mean it is binary. I should be able to specify a list of file extensions that always get treated as text. The attached files demonstrate the problem. Add them to a repository, make changes, and watch the Spanish and Chinese files not give a preview of changes while English works just fine.
fields.summary: preview changes of text-based files even if using Unicode

fields.description: Attempting to fetch from a stash repository, when I clicked on the button to edit the .gitignore file for the project, SourceTree crashed.
fields.summary: crashes when attempting to read .gitignore file

fields.description: I cloned a repository from BitBucket (https://bitbucket.org/dunlapm/todolist-c) in SourceTree. While browsing the project source, I accidentally clicked on the 'show/hide' control for 'Branches' (circled in red in the attached screen shot). Doing so collapsed the branches - and crashed SourceTree.
fields.summary: SourceTree crashed when collapsing the "Branches" branch

fields.description:
When trying to add a subtree from a private Git repository using the HTTPS protocol the program hangs at 'Adding Subtree:' stage. Full output shows no output after the first two git commands.

Using the SSH protocol works, as does using both protocols over the HTTPS protocol.

This has been tested on private repos with Assembla and Bitbucket, along with public repos with Github.
fields.summary: Add/Link Subtree hangs on private Git repos when https protocol used

fields.description:
It would be useful to be able to select & copy text from the hunk viewer.

Quite a few times now I've wanted to grab some deleted text from a hunk to use elsewhere, but I have to open the External Diff viewer and copy from there to do it.
fields.summary: Copy text from diff summary

fields.description:
Alt-Tab from a build tool back to SourceTree for Windows, then it crashed and produced a crash report.

Note that all .git repository directories mentioned in the crash report are in fact there, and these repositories are in fact git repositories.
Somehow SourceTree got confused.
fields.summary: Crash

fields.description:
Instead of navigating through the list of bookmarks and double+clicking, it would be nice to have a hotkey to open a quick search of all the repo/bookmark names to open.  So, without a mouse, I could do ctrl+<some key> and then type the first few letters of the repo or bookmark to open it.

Perhaps "open" is not the right word, but you get the idea.
fields.summary: Hotkey to open repository

fields.description:
Please may I request that SourceTree be enhanced to keep most-recently-used messages at the top of the "Recent messages" list.

It seems that if you select (or manually type) a message that matches an item further down the current "Recent messages" list, that item remains in its original position. I request that it be reset to the top of the list.
fields.summary: Manage "Recent messages" list to show most recent messages at top

fields.description:
When you rename a file, in SourceTree it's handled as the old file being deleted and the new one created which loses the history.

can you fix?
fields.summary: SourceTree handles renamed files as new files

fields.description:
Our SVN repository required specify Jira issue on each commit. So when I tried to create new Subversion branch I am failed with:

A repository hook failed: MERGE request failed on '/svn/test/': Commit blocked by pre-commit hook (exit code 1) with output:
Committer: XXXXX
Commit message: "Create branch test"
Commit rejected: No project accepts this commit. Project [*]: Commit message must contain at least one valid issue key.

Now I see only one workaround - specify the Issue key in the name of branch. But it isn't suitable for each case.
fields.summary: Allow to specify commit message on create Subversion branch.

fields.description: When adding a remote repository it would be efficient if it were possible to select one from a drop-down list (bitbucket/github existing repositories)
fields.summary: Select remote repository from drop-down

fields.description:
Accessibility issue - they can be difficult to distinguish for colorblind users. The +/- margin markers mean it's still possible but would be better to allow customisation.

Already implemented in Mac version according to SRCTREE-844
fields.summary: Allow diff panel color customization

fields.description:
From Visual Studio (and other tools, but lets take Visual Studio as an exampl here), I've configured the diff integration to always append the {{/solo}} argument.

What this does is very nifty: it starts a new instance of Beyond Compare for each call (otherwise it will first look for an existing Beyond Compare instance open then a new compare/merge tab in the first instance it founds).

It comes in especially handy when you have multiple instances of Visual Studio open: 

_The net result of {{/solo}} is that if you press {{Esc}} or {{Alt-F4}} to get out of Beyond Compare, you immediately return to the Visual Studio session you started the compare/merge from._

Without {{/solo}} you will not return to Visual Studio (you need to find which instance of Visual Studio called it by pressing Alt-Tab, or moving over your task bar).

From the Beyond Compare docs at http://www.scootersoftware.com/help/command_line_reference.html

{quote}
*Command Line Switches*

 *Note*  Linux users should prefix the switches with "-" instead of "/".

||Switch||Meaning||
|{{/solo}}|Forces a new instance of the program.|
{quote}
fields.summary: Allow for a "Beyond Compare /solo" next to the regular "Beyond Compare"

fields.description: I'm running SourceTree behind a proxy and the check for updates feature is not working. Under network I've checked "Use default operating system settings" but it still isn't working. My proxy is set via "Use automatic configuration scripts" found in the LAN settings.
fields.summary: Check for Updates does not work behind proxy

fields.description:
sourcetree installs git-flow in %USERPROFILE%\AppData\Local\Atlassian\SourceTree

which in my case is C:\Users\do'riordan\AppData\Local\Atlassian\SourceTree

**(note the " ' " in username portion)**

Using the GUI, git-flow init it tries to run from a path C:\Users\doriordan\AppData\ - note, no " ' ". 

{quote}
sh.exe C:\Users\do'riordan\AppData\Local\Atlassian\SourceTree\gitflow_local\gitflow\git-flow init -d
"C:/Program Files (x86)/Git/bin/sh.exe": C:\Users\doriordan\AppData\Local\Atlassian\SourceTree\gitflow_local\gitflow\git-flow init -d: No such file or directory

Completed with errors, see above.
{quote}

some background...
My username in active directory was changed from do'riordan to doriordan. According to http://support.microsoft.com/kb/2454362 this doesn't affect the local user profile dir. So now my %username% does not match  %USERPROFILE% or %LOCALAPPDATA%

see attached screenshot for my environment variables.

There would be an easy work around if i could tell sourcetree where to find git-flow? Not sure if this is possible though.
fields.summary: git-flow init does not run successfully

fields.description:
When using version 1.4.1 I was able to apply a patch created by my colleague (who is running version 1.5.2) and he was unable to apply that same patch.  I updated to version 1.5.2 and now have the same issue.  I am using git 1.9 and am configured to use the system's git.

Every time, I attempted to apply the patch to the working files (not the entire commit)
fields.summary: 1.5.2.0 cannot apply a patch

fields.description:
When logged into my Bitbucket account on SourceTree, if I use the globe button to search Bitbucket for repositories to clone, the HTTPS URL that it fills in is considered invalid.

Steps:
1. Connect SourceTree to a Bitbucket account.
2. Use the Clone/New button to clone a new repo
3. Press the globe button to search for a Bitbucket repo
4. Select a repo and hit OK

The resulting URL uses my email address instead of my username, so that there are two @'s in the URL, and SourceTree considers it invalid.
fields.summary: Unable to clone Bitbucket git repo over HTTP with email

fields.description:
Please consider a setting that allows SHA numbers and other similar hexadecimal strings to be UPPER case as well as lower case. Personally I much prefer to see something like 38ADF3E than 38adf3e.

If this is easy to add then please consider it, its low hanging fruit.
fields.summary: SHA, Hexadecimal Notation

fields.description:
As a SourceTree user, I want an option in the Discard dialog that allows me to remove Untracked files and empty folders so that I can easily reset everything in my directory and mirror the VCS state exactly.

# When I have Untracked files and empty folders in my working directly, the 'Discard' button is available.
# When I click the Discard button, the Discard dialog shows up with a 'Show Untracked Files and Folders' checkbox
# When I click the 'Show Untracked Files and Folders' checkbox, Untracked files and empty folders are listed along with any other changed files
# When I check the Untracked files and empty folders and click 'Discard Changes', the checked untracked files and empty folders are removed.
# When I click the 'Reset All' tab in the Discard dialog, there is a 'Remove Untracked Files and Folders' checkbox
# When I click the 'Remove Untracked Files and Folders' checkbox and click 'Reset All', all Untracked files and empty folders are removed as a part of the Reset All step.
# When I Reset All in this way, any files ignored by the VCS are not touched.
fields.summary: Discard/Reset Dialog Option to Remove Untracked Files and Folders

fields.description: Please may I request that SourceTree show a tooltip if I hover on a long branch name or stash name-plus-message. Otherwise, I have to widen the pane to view the full name[-plus-message] (or select the item, but that forces a change to the contents of the rightmost pane).
fields.summary: Show tooltips for long branch or stash names

fields.description:
I have a sub repository that requires authentication.
When I add this repository as a subtree, push, or pull, the dialog stops after it says

> git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false subtree push -P (my subdirectory) http://(mysub repository).git master
> git push using: http://(mysub repository).git master

It seems like git.exe is asking my username and password.
fields.summary: Freezes when adding subtree from repository that requires authentication

fields.description:
default charset = utf-8

In the interactive rebasing schedule dialog, squashed message becomes like "????????????" when I squashed commits with Japanese message.

Even I rewrite the message, the generated commit still holds a message like "??????????".

Non-ASCII characters seems not dealed with appropriately.
fields.summary: Japanese characters in comment turns into '?' on interactive rebasing

fields.description: Please add a middle-click event on a repo tab to close the tab. I typically have quite a few repos open at anytime and it's difficult to close them because the "x" on the right of the tab changes location based on the title of the repo. A standard tab width would help too, but a middle click would match most tabbed environments to close it.
fields.summary: Add middle-click to close a tab.

fields.description: In Tools > Options > Git I have selected "Do not fast-forward when merging, always create commit", however if I rebase my feature branch (and I assume any other branch) interactively on the same commit the branch I intend to merge with is (i.e. develop) and then select Git Flow > Finish Feature the action simply rebases develop on the feature commit, instead of creating a new merge commit.
fields.summary: Fast Forward on Rebase

fields.description: If I cancel editing a custom action the *Edit Custom Action* dialog is redisplayed. Cancelling it a second time correctly dismisses it.
fields.summary: Cancelling editing a custom action redisplays the Edit Custom Action dialog

fields.description: Any plans for a 64bit Version for Windows?
fields.summary: 64bit Version for Windows

fields.description:
This is not going to be a particularly helpful bug report, but there's not much I can do about it.

Windows 7 64 bit. Latest version of SourceTree (also happened with older ones though). My disk is an Intel 320 Series 120gb SSD. Latest updates, latest drivers on everything.

When ST is open, I randomly get BSODs. There is absolutely no pattern to it whatsoever. I don't even have to be interacting with ST for it to happen, so my guess is that the issue is connected to the directory monitoring. It took me a long time to even figure out ST was causing it...

The length between BSODs might be 5 minutes or more than a day.

It's not even the same message every time! I've gotten IRQL_NOT_LESS_OR_EQUAL, PAGE_FAULT_IN_NONPAGED_AREA, QUOTA_UNDERFLOW...

Reading this your natural reaction will be that it's not ST causing it, but I'm 100% positive. I have _never_ gotten a BSOD while ST was closed.

Hope you can find it!
fields.summary: Random BSODs on Win 7

fields.description:
It would be nice to have possibility to organize the groups of branches.

For example I would like to have groups: 
"Inactive" (old unclosed branches)
"My" (my branches)
"Release X.Y.Z"  (branches for release x.y.z)
etc...

It makes possible to filter branches and hide inactive branches.

Also such feature would be useful for tags. For example: "last year releases", "internal releases", etc...

PS: thank you for your product.
fields.summary: Mercurial. Grouping of Branches

fields.description: I use ConEmu at work and Console2 at home.  I would like to be able to e launch Git from SourceTree within these environments, rather than in the vanilla cmd.exe bash window.
fields.summary: Add the ability to configure the "Terminal" command line.

fields.description: "Keep the commit window open if there are still outstanding changes" is a handy feature for those of us who like small, atomic commits.
fields.summary: Add a check box, like in GitExtensions, that keeps the commit window open.

fields.description:
Launching Explorer from the right-click menu: 8 seconds.
Launching Beyond Compare using Shift+Ctrl+D: 3-20 seconds.
Launching terminal: 0 seconds.
Launching web browser from Help menu items: 0 seconds

Quite frustrating.
fields.summary: Launching some external executables is extremely slow.

fields.description:
I have configured SourceTree to use BeyondCompare 3 as my external diff tool.  Often when I select more than 1 file in the "File Status" window and press the "External Diff" button 1 or 2 files are missing.  This happens even when the number of files selected is low (3-4 files) and my "Max File Count" setting is high (25).

Generally only 1 file is missing but sometimes 2 files
fields.summary: External diff sometimes omits multiple files

fields.description:
Sometimes, when we select a bunch of files with Shift + Mouse click. and when I am trying to cancel my selection, then I found Sourcetree cannot loose the selection on these files.  This is really boring, and normally I will meet this issue a few times per day.

I expect a more used behavior from sourcetree as below:
1. select all files
2. when click on one of selected file, we could unselect it.
fields.summary: cannot unselect files when all files in "Working Copy Changes" are been selected

fields.description: Treid to create a patch in the root C: directory, SourceTree crashed.
fields.summary: Crash on creating patch file if permission isn't available

fields.description: If you try to clone a git repository from a linux to windows and the local path lenght limit can cause failure. There windows allow to use "very long" path names with the prefix \\?\ . But source tree is reconize such pathes as valid.
fields.summary: Allow to clone repository with \\?\  for very long path names on window

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce*

# Create a new test repository locally in Sourcetree
# Create and commit an empty file, {{test.txt}}
# Add a line of content {{foobar}} to {{test.txt}} and commit the changes
# Create and switch to a new branch called {{feature}}
# Edit the line of content in {{test.txt}} to {{spamandeggs}} and commit the changes
# Switch back to the {{master}}, amend the line of content in {{test.txt}} to {{foobarspaz}} and amend the latest commit (i.e. the commit from step 3), selecting OK to the sure changing history warning dialog
# Switch to the {{feature}} branch and:
## right click on the latest commit on {{master}} and select the *Rebase children of <hash> interactively* option
## delete the commit that appears that corresponds to the commit in step 3
## hit OK

*Expected results*

The rebase conflicts, and Sourcetree allows me to edit and resolve the conflict and to continue the interactive rebase.

*Actual results*

The rebase conflicts and hitting *Close* on the interactive rebase dialog (see attached screenshot) aborts the rebase.

FWIW if from the command line I run {{git rebase -i master}}, resolve my conflict, and run {{git rebase --continue}} the rebase succeeds, so I'd expect I should be able to do the same from within Sourcetree.
fields.summary: 'Rebasing from' description specifies the wrong commit - should be parent commit

fields.description:
Could you please add prompted parameters for Custom Actions? You provide placeholders for common variables like $SHA and $FILE but the feature would be a lot more flexible if if accepted something sort of named parameters.

For example, $PROMPT:BRANCH could result in a UI prompt for a variable labeled BRANCH.
fields.summary: Parameter Prompt for Custom Actions

fields.description:
if you compare with Giteye (the Free fit client from collebnet), apparently following feature is more convenience than SourceTree:

-          Any platform Windows, Mac, Linux
-          All self-included (zip), no need install git/ssh, no need for local admin for windows installation
-          Embedded file explorer, you can browse structured folder from the client
-          Import all your existing git repo in one step
-          Interactive git rebase GUI view
-          JIRA integration as Task management to allow you have a local task scheduler
fields.summary: feature to make sourcetree comparable to GitEye

fields.description:
When using SourceTree in the context of Salesforce development it is sometimes necessary to refresh local source files from the Salesforce server this leads to many more files showing as modified in the working copy than have been truly modified. 

The behaviour of the Salesforce retrieval tool is such that all files will be written and carry a new timestamp although the contents are unchanged. The files are shown as modified with the modified icon but when selected correctly state that the file is unmodified.

This negatively impacts usability since on the occasions a user needs to refresh their local files from Salesforce the majority of the repository shows as modified masking the few genuine changes.
fields.summary: Identification of working copy changes

fields.description:
It would be nice if there was an option to select more than one SSH key file on the General tab of the Options dialog.

I use some different keys for different teams/hosts I work with and when I need to connect to a host that requires a key other than  the configured one I have to rightclick the pageant icon on system tray and add the other keys manually.
fields.summary: Option to select more than one SSH Key

fields.description:
This is a container report for all other reports.

Microsoft have decided not to fix the issue right now - we are looking into a workaround in the meantime. The error is caused by, based on using reflector to check the problem code in the MS libs, a null ref check being missed.

Here's the MS connect issue: http://connect.microsoft.com/VisualStudio/feedback/details/549867/ui-automation-throws-unexpected-exceptions-in-xbap-application
fields.summary: GetNameCore Crash Bug

fields.description:
This happens although I have no GitHub, BitBucket connected ~ which might be the reason?

All my connections are via SSH and they don't seem to have a problem with connection, what could possibly cause it to pop up authentication overnight?
fields.summary: Authentication pop up keeps appearing

fields.description:
If I select all the rows in Working Copy Changes, I cannot then unselect some of those rows.  The only way to unselect is to move them all to Staged Changes and then move them back to Working Copy Changes.

I have created a [video|http://screencast.com/t/uaPmmq4YfP7] to demonstrate the issue...

[!http://thumb.screencast.com/3/f9f3cf9b-91f3-48f5-9c21-72ee4e9db017/thumb.gif!|http://screencast.com/t/uaPmmq4YfP7]
fields.summary: cannot unselect working copy changes

fields.description:
We use GitFlow for features which allows us to build releases by merging in individual features when they are ready. This process works great and the UI for GitFlow is awesome.

However, we find the UI for SourceTree falls slightly short when try to quickly view which features have been merged into a release branch and which have not. For this we fall back to Git Extensions as it has a 'Grey out non-relatives' feature which greys out the lines of all branches that have not been merged into the currently checked out branch (screenshot attached). This is super handy as it gives us a great visual overview of which features are on which release branch. If this were to be added I would transition my whole team to SourceTree as the only GIT UI.
fields.summary: Tree - Grey out commits / lines not in checked out branch

fields.description:
Source tree crashed on windows machine.

See attached logs.
fields.summary: Source tree crashed again..!!!

fields.description:
Interactive rebase usually works fine, but when it comes to 2-bit character language such as Korean or Chinese, all 2-bit character will be replaced with "??".
For example, interactive rebase for editing message "English, 한국어, 中國語"(which means English, Korean, Chinese accordingly) actually creates a commit with message of "English, ??????, ??????"
fields.summary: Interactive Rebase corrupts 2-bit character commits.

fields.description:
When double clicking an unmodified file:
Open with default text editor as specified in git config.

When double clicking a modified file:
Open with external diff tool if one is specified, else open with default git diff tool.

When double clicking a conflicted file:
Open with external merge tool if one is specified, else open with defautl git diff tool.

This would be a HUGE usability improvement over navigating little right click submenus over and over for each item that is conflicted.

Thanks.
fields.summary: Launch contextually appropriate tool when double clicking a file.

fields.description:
There is currently no shortcut set for "launch external merge tool". Rather than adding one, why not use the same shortcut as "launch external diff tool", ctrl+d, and decide which of the two is appropriate based on the currently selected item.

Thanks.
fields.summary: Use ctrl+d shortcut for launch external merge tool when conflicted item is selected

fields.description:
I mistyped my username once for a http based BitBucket Mercurial connection.

Now SourceTree does not allow me to enter the username any more.

This is while pushing changes to a Mercurial Repository that requires login.

Restarting SourceTree does not work
I'm not allowed to run credential storage sniffer tools.

I'm behind a CNTLM proxy that works (I can push from the command-line hg fine, which also goes through the same CNTLM proxy).

Please make SourceTree enable both username and password when re-entering credentials.
fields.summary: HG: cannot reset the username in my http authentication

fields.description:
I click on the SourceTree icon in the Win 8.1 start page, and after a delay the main window appears - followed almost immediately by the  "Ooops" error dialog, which then keeps appearing and disappearing

I got it from sourcetreeapp.com
fields.summary: SourceTree crashes on startup, repeatedly showing the report error dialog box

fields.description:
This happens when displaying the changes for a file in the log. 

When files have a certain number of changes (1739 lines added on the last file that made the problem occur), SourceTree for windows freezes (greyed out the full window), then pops a new ST icon in the task bar, which replace the original one after a couple seconds. Sometimes the ST icon will disappear completely before getting a new one (looks like the app actually crash and restarts silently). Sometimes the UI gets updated (greyed out removed) and display a froozen spinner. If one click anywhere, the app will get greyed out again. It would do this a couple of time before unfreezing and displaying the changes. 

The whole process could take a couple of minutes before the UI is responsive again. 

Looking at a different file and coming back to the "troubled" one would start the whole freeze issue again.

No submodule, 1 active branch at the moment, running it from the command line is smooth and fast, last version of Java installed, using built-in GIT. Same problem wether the commits are fetched or pull. Happened on every file and every project that has the issue.
fields.summary: UI Freezes when line change is getting big

fields.description:
Allow the branch name in the commit flow to be selectable copyable.

We encourage to use the jira ticket number for the branch and also with the commit message so that when the branch is merged and deleted, the commit mesaage has the information. It would be easier to copy paste the ticket number from the branch name if it is selectable. 

Thanks.
fields.summary: Allow the branch name in the commit flow to be selectable copyable.

fields.description:
I host a stash instance on a server called builder within our network. The URL to that stash instance is https://builder:8443. When I add this to sourcetree as a location of hosted projects and attempt to browse those projects I get the error:

    >The underlying connection was closed: Could not establish trust relationship for the SSL/TLS secure channel.

Our network administrators enforce a policy of not trusting any SSL certificates and this is not a policy they can change.

In git I use the http.sslVerify=false to force a connection over https without trusting the certificate and within sourcetree>options>git there is a "Disable SSL certificate validation" option (that I assume just sets sslverify=false in the .gitconfig).

Perhaps sourcetree could dual-purpose the "Disable SSL certificate..." checkbox in the settings to also ignore SSL warnings in the hosted projects browser?
fields.summary: SourceTree cannot see hosted projects from an https location with a self-signed certificate

fields.description: It would be intuitive if multiple lines could be selected by drag select for purposes of easily discarding/staging changed lines.
fields.summary: Allow drag-select multiple lines in file differences panel

fields.description:
It is very tedious to click the small 'discard selected lines' button, especially when you have to scroll down to find it b/c there are a large number of changed lines in the file.

ctrl+shift+r is discard selection, but that appears to be the file selected within the working copy changes window. Either add a new shortcut for 'discard selected lines', or, if there are selected lines that is treated as the selection for the ctrl+shift+r action.
fields.summary: Keyboard shortcut for Discard Selected Lines

fields.description:
I try to send commit to the my repository on bitbucket.org and SourceTree fails with strange error (see screenshot)

I have proxy in my corporate network - may be problem with it, but Tortoise Hg works properly
fields.summary: Error while sending commit to Bitbucket

fields.description: When doing an interactive rebase and editing a commit message, pressing enter while in the textbox cancels the edit instead of accepting it. You have to click on the OK button to accept the change.
fields.summary: Pressing enter in Interactive Rebase -> Edit Message cancels the dialog

fields.description:
If I open the interactive rebase dialog and immediately cancel it, it "fails" with the following error:

{code}git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false -c "sequence.editor='C:\Program Files (x86)\Atlassian\SourceTree\stree_gri'" -c "core.editor='C:\Program Files (x86)\Atlassian\SourceTree\stree_gri'" rebase -i --autosquash
Could not execute editor

Completed with errors, see above.{code}

As the rebase was cancelled I wouldn't expect to be presented with an error dialog.
fields.summary: Cancelling interactive rebase results in an error

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce*

1. Start an interactive rebase
2. Select *Edit Message* for a commit
3. Paste in a message that contains newlines
4. Manually hit Enter in the message dialog

*Expected results*

3. The message is pasted in verbatim
4. A newline is added in the textarea

*Actual results*

3. Only the first line of the message is appears
4. The dialog is cancelled
fields.summary: Newlines are thrown away when editing a message from an interactive rebase

fields.description:
I have configured SourceTree to detect jira issue Id in commit messages and it works as expected.

When I create a branch, I put the jira issue id as branch name. it would be great if sourcetree could display the name of the jira issue in a tooltip or near the branch name so that I can easily know the purpose the the branch.

BTW, you could do the same when detecting jira issue Id in commit messages.
fields.summary: Display jira issue name when a branch name is a jira issue number

fields.description:
- Creating feature (or other) branch in Jira (stash)
 - Select fetch from remotes
 - navigate to branch and check out
 - collapse remotes

- sourcetree crashes
fields.summary: Sourcetree crashes when collapsing remotes tree

fields.description:
Development rarely involves a single repository lately.
And adding 30+ repositories one by one to source tree is a bit of an avoidable hassle.

Is it not possible to look for git roots, under sub folders when using
Clone / New -> Add Working Copy
step?
fields.summary: Reading Git Root(s) under a specified directory

fields.description:
h1. Steps to reproduce

1. Start with a SourceTree for Windows version less than 1.5.1
2. Run the auto-update process
3. Select version 1.5.1

You will see this when downloading fails with the message 

{code}
Error: Wrong file size
{code}

h1. Cause:

http://www.sourcetreeapp.com/update/windowsupdates.txt is wrong for Version 1.5.1:

{code}
[1.5.1]
Name=SourceTree
ProductVersion=1.5.2
URL=http://downloads.atlassian.com/software/sourcetree/windows/SourceTreeSetup_1.5.2.exe
Size=9749256
MD5=0c651988cf3d2fac67aedea88a06d196
{code}

h1. Solution:

Modify {{URL}} to be this:

{code}
URL=http://downloads.atlassian.com/software/sourcetree/windows/SourceTreeSetup_1.5.1.exe
{code}

Since the {{URL}} is wrong, both the {{Size}} and {{MD5}} will mismatch. The auto-update UI only mentions the Size failure.
fields.summary: Updating from < 1.5.1 specifically to 1.5.1 fails

fields.description:
Let's say I make a commit with following message:

My commit message
Another newline text

When looking at this commit in grid that lists all commits for certain repository, SourceTree presents it as a single liner:

My commit message Another newline text

I would love if you gave us an option to specify what replaces newline (\n). Currently it's obvious you do it with empty space ( ), but let's say I want it to be pipe with spaces ( | ) so that output becomes:

My commit message | Another newline text

I think it's a small, non-breaking change change that would help a lot for some of us that are bit more descriptive in their commit messages.
fields.summary: Split char for newlines in commits listing
Error while updating embeeded git

fields.description: I did a Fetch in SourceTree to remove a bunch of remote branches that had been deleted from origin. Now, randomly when expanding or working with the Remotes > Origin branches SourceTree crashes.
fields.summary: SourceTree constantly crashing

fields.description: Run SourceTree. It comes up, I right mouse click on the project and get the error that's in the log
fields.summary: Crash possible .net error

fields.description:
The default tab when you first clone a new repository is the "File Status" tab, with "Show Pending" selected, which results in basically a big empty space. I was watching as someone new to Sourcetree was trying to use this and they basically had a "Uh.. now what?" moment at this point.

I think it would be much more useful to have the "Log/history" tab open as the default (at least after cloning an existing repo):

 * Some content is shown, and it becomes clear you haven't operated on anything yet
 * A (configurable) portion of the Log/History tab shows the same content as the File Status tab anyway. I personally never use the File Status tab at all for this reason alone.
fields.summary: "Log/History" should be the default tab instead of "File Status"

fields.description: When keeping sourcetree open and using openssh authentication, there's audible static and popping when listening to any sort of audio. This is noticeable both in the headphone and normal audio channels. Changing it to putty/plink and restarting the program causes the audio static to vanish. Never experienced this using any other program on my platform.
fields.summary: Audio static when using openssh authentication

fields.description:
I have a fresh installation of SourceTree 1.5.2 and .NET 4.5.1 (4.5 also tried) on Windows 7, 32-bit.  When I attempt to add a GitHub account I get the following error:

        "Data at the root level is invalid.  Line 1, position 1."

(see attached screenshot)

I also get this message when browsing "Hosted Projects" or managing the creditials for the GitHub hosted project.

This issue is marked as a blocker because I'm behind a corporate firewall that does not allow SSH, which is common for enterprise environments.
fields.summary: "Data at the root level is invalid."

fields.description:
Can Interactive Rebase in SourceTree be updated to handle more complex rebase scenarios?

e.g., `git rebase --interactive --onto newVersion oldVersion master`
fields.summary: Add complex interactive rebase

fields.description: On Commit the log message should be checked against existing jira issue numbers
fields.summary: It would be nice to execute an custom action on commit

fields.description: In the same way you can "Use global user settings" for the User Information for a repository, it would be good if you could use a global setting for Commit Text Links. We have a proprietary bug database system, and all of our repositories use the same regular expression format for commit messages.
fields.summary: Make "Commit Text Link" settings span repositories

fields.description:
When trying to checkout my repo in github, sourceTree show the progression bar for a few second then displays a popup telling me that it has crashed. Here is the logs.

The repo is https://github.com/OoDeLally/SNN.

Hope it helps!
fields.summary: Crash when checkout from github

fields.description:
When using Git Flow the option _'Do not fast-forward when merging, alway create commit'_ set under _'Tools > Options'_ is ignored.

When using Git Flow's feature, release and/or hotfix options this setting is being ignored. If for example a feature is created and finished Git Flow fast-forwards this feature into develop. Merging these branches 'by hand' will honor the setting, but defeats the purpose of using Git Flow and increases the risk of errors while branching.
fields.summary: Git Flow ignores set options

fields.description: When an interactive rebase is in progress (started from the commandline), and it has stopped to allow the user to amend the last commit, SourceTree only offers "continue" or "abort" options when the Commit button is clicked.
fields.summary: Commit not allowed during interactive rebase

fields.description: When doing an interactive rebase through SourceTree and I check the "Amend" checkbox for a commit but make no other changes, the rebase starts but is very quickly aborted by SourceTree.
fields.summary: Interactive rebase 'amend' does not work

fields.description:
Intermittently, with multiple(10 or so) large repos (.git file is about 1.27GB ), source tree will use up all available memory on the machine.

On my 8GB RAM machine, at times source tree uses 7.5GB of RAM.

I would be glad to provide logs, etc. to help reproduce the issue. I believe it is during fetch that it happens.
fields.summary: Large Memory Leak

fields.description:
"Reverse commit..." does not work for merges.

We need an option to reverse merges which is equivalent to the "git revert -m" command.
fields.summary: Support reversing/reverting of merges in git

fields.description:
Just having SourceTree open results in thrashing sometimes several times a second of the users hard disk.

A temp file is created with an apparent cookie in order to connect to mercurial.  This file is then deleted and a new one created over and over again 24/7 as long as SourceTree is open.

At one point the files were failing to get deleted and I had thousands of them.

The contents of the temp file are like this:

# Netscape HTTP Cookie File
# http://www.netscape.com/newsref/std/cookie_spec.html
# This is a generated file! Do not edit.

company.kilnhg.com FALSE / FALSE fSetNewFogBugzAuthCookie 1
company.kilnhg.com FALSE / FALSE fbToken 01a2b3c4defgh05ijklm6789nopqrs

In addition, there were periodic files with nothing in them:
hg-bundle-dqzslc.hg

The path in question is:
%userprofile%\AppData\Local\Temp

The files are being created in the root.

I ran Process Monitor to see what is creating this:

4:07:16.8791615 PM	hg.exe	3004	CreateFile	C:\Users\KALBRIGHT\AppData\Local\Temp\tmppsz4zf	SUCCESS	Desired Access: Generic Read/Write, Disposition: Create, Options: Synchronous IO Non-Alert, Non-Directory File, Attributes: N, ShareMode: Read, Write, AllocationSize: 0, OpenResult: Created
4:07:16.8794614 PM	hg.exe	3004	QueryInformationVolume	C:\Users\KALBRIGHT\AppData\Local\Temp\tmppsz4zf	BUFFER OVERFLOW	VolumeCreationTime: 10/1/2012 3:57:33 PM, VolumeSerialNumber: 7000-64BD, SupportsObjects: True, VolumeLabel: Winē
4:07:16.8795009 PM	hg.exe	3004	QueryAllInformationFile	C:\Users\KALBRIGHT\AppData\Local\Temp\tmppsz4zf	BUFFER OVERFLOW	CreationTime: 4/30/2014 4:07:16 PM, LastAccessTime: 4/30/2014 4:07:16 PM, LastWriteTime: 4/30/2014 4:07:16 PM, ChangeTime: 4/30/2014 4:07:16 PM, FileAttributes: A, AllocationSize: 0, EndOfFile: 0, NumberOfLinks: 1, DeletePending: False, Directory: False, IndexNumber: 0x34c0000000016c0, EaSize: 0, Access: Generic Read/Write, Position: 0, Mode: Synchronous IO Non-Alert, AlignmentRequirement: Word

If I close SourceTree, there's no longer an hg.exe process running to create these temp files.  

Surely there's a better way to save off the authentication rather than redoing it over and over possibly prematurely wearing out hard drives in the process.

[Update]: added .csv log file from SysInternals ProcMon showing the flurry of file activity from hg.exe (spawned by SourceTree).  Over the span of 3 1/2 minutes, there are 474,486 events!  Not just the temp files but there is a very frequent read of library.zip.  If I close SourceTree, there is NO activity appearing in ProcMon. (I'm filtering on Process hg.exe)
fields.summary: temp file and general file trashing disk several times second.

fields.description:
When large files are viewed in the diff viewer, the commit buttons are displayed below the file. On larger files this is displayed out of view.

It would be better I think if the buttons are displayed outside of the scrolled area.
fields.summary: Leave staging buttons (Stage hunk, Stage selected lines etc) in view

fields.description:
My team has a lot of code review meetings in conference rooms in which we review code changes from Git. This work is done on VGA-based flat screen TV's in the conference rooms, so we are restricted to VGA resolutions. Whenever we use SourceTree to walk through changes (either working copy changes or staged and/or committed changes), we spend a lot of time resizing the SourceTree panes to see the green/red differences.

It would be great if there were a way to store some kind of "View Configuration" that is optimized for the crummy VGA displays in these rooms. This view would basically hide everything except for the "Working Copy Changes" and the differences pane.

Or, enable a shortcut key that would treat the native difference viewer in SourceTree (which is actually a really good difference engine) as if it were a standalone app like BeyondCompare or Araxis Merge. If this diff started up in a standalone window, with maybe some dedicated buttons to enlarge or shrink the font size, then my team could do group code reviews much more efficiently and rapidly.
fields.summary: Enable a mode or view that shows only the file differences in a maximized window

fields.description:
Repro Steps

1. Create some working copy changes in a branch by editing a few files.
2. From the "Working Copy Changes" pane, click on the first file and then use "Ctrl+A" to select all files in the pane.
3. Now cause the pane to lose focus by clicking somewhere else (for example on a previous commit)
4. Switch back to the change from #2 above and note that all files are still selected. No matter what you do, you cannot  de-select the files in this view.

The only workaround I've found is to exit and then restart SourceTree.

EXPECTED BEHAVIOR:

A) When focus is lost, none of the files in the pane should be selected; or
B) If I click on a single file from among all selected files, it should become the only selected file, implicitly de-selecting all other files.

NOTE: This behavior is not a recent regression. I have been experiencing different flavors of this underlying bug for over a year.

NOTE 2: Behavior *only* affects the "Working Copy Changes" pane. It does *not* repro if any other row in the Graph/Description grid is selected.
fields.summary: Ctrl-A with Working Copy Changes permanently selects all files even after focus is lost

fields.description: Hi. May I request that the drop-down to select either "All Branches" or "Current Branch" be replaced with a check-box "Show All Local Branches" (placed next to the existing "Show Remote Branches" check-box) in order to make it easy to toggle between the two modes.
fields.summary: Replace "All Branches/Current Branch" drop-down with checkbox "Show All Branches"

fields.description:
A summary of the problem can be found here
https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/263754/nuget-packages-and-source-tree?page=1#289713
fields.summary: Erroneous files in Working Copy Changes (related to nuget)

fields.description:
When I'm try to watch difference in my one file - it shows cyrillic symbols (encoding windows-1251) wrong. But when I select all files - diff viewer show symbols normally

http://i56.fastpic.ru/big/2014/0430/07/faec8a7f6f5c244762a03042798f4207.png

There is a branch on answers website:
https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/289425/encoding-error-in-default-diff-view
fields.summary: Encoding error in default diff view

fields.description:
It is possible to select the delete branch option for the active branch, but when the delete option is executed (even with the force checkbox checked) it will always fail as you are not allowed to delete your active (local) branch.

I suggest greying out this option in the context menu when you are requesting the context menu for the active branch so you cannot initiate a delete action on that branch.

Not sure if you can also use the delete key, but if that is the case this should also be intercepted before actually trying the removal (and failing) as fail early is better IMHO.
fields.summary: Do not enable delete branch option in context menu for active branch

fields.description:
Shelving changes a second time under the same name overwrites the previous changes.

For example: I make a change to a text file: first.txt and then shelve it under the name s1. I then make another change to a file called second.txt and shelve it under s1. If I now unshelve s1 I only ever get second.txt in my workspace. And I cannot after unshelving second.txt unshelve first.txt in any way. So my first changes inside s1 are lost and there is no way to get them back.
fields.summary: Shelving changes a second time under the same name overwrites the previous changes

fields.description: Things like fixing a typo mark the whole paragraph of text red in files like LaTeX, HTML, or just plaintext files with natural language texts. As far as I know, Git has built-in support for word by word diff. Please make it available through SourceTree.
fields.summary: Word by word diff option for plaintext files (e.g., LaTeX)

fields.description:
The checkbox label text is localized with grammar errors.

!agree_to_transfer_of_usage_data.PNG!

Instead it should read for example "Helfe dabei Sourcetree zu verbessern, indem du Sourcetree _Daten über deine Nutzung_ an uns senden lässt"
fields.summary: Incorrect german L10n

fields.description: I used SourceTree these days, we have hundreds remote branches in our projects. sometimes I find a branch so difficult to scroll from up to bottom, so long of this list, I can't find a branch quickly, no search function in it.
fields.summary: I find a remote branch difficult

fields.description:
Changing diff drop-down in 'File Status' section from 'Show All' to 'Show Pending' does not reflect this change in 'Log History' section. Restart of Source Tree solves the issue

ACTUAL BEHAVIOUR :
If I have uncommitted changes in 3 files and I change the filter from 'Show All' to 'Show Pending', only 3 files are shown in indexing area in 'File Status' but all files show in 'Log History' section.

EXPECTED BEHAVIOUR :
'File Status' and 'Log History' section should always reflect the same number of uncommitted changed files.
fields.summary: Changing diff drop-down in 'File Status' section from 'Show All' to 'Show Pending' does not reflect this change in 'Log History' section
